keyTakeAways: Lance Bass has type 1.5 diabetes, also known as latent autoimmune diabetes (LAD), and uses Dexcom continuous glucose monitoring to manage his condition.
He created an online persona called 'Blood Sugar Lance' to educate others about diabetes with humor and share personal experiences, which developed accidentally on social media.
Bass recalls that before continuous monitoring, he frequently left glucose testing supplies at home due to difficulty in tracking his levels.
He identifies white foods (like white rice and white bread) as major triggers for blood sugar spikes, even with insulin use.
His uncle had type 1 diabetes, which influenced his early awareness of diabetes-related dietary restrictions.
Stress from his busy career and parenting his four-year-old twins affects his blood sugar levels.
Despite fan interest in a potential N’Sync reunion, Lance Bass has no plans for a reunion tour at this time and dismisses unverified reports as inaccurate.
The support from the diabetic community and advancements in monitoring technology have significantly improved his daily life and diabetes management.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Lance Bass, former member of the boy band N’Sync, shares insights into his life with type 1.5 diabetes, also known as latent autoimmune diabetes (LAD), emphasizing how continuous glucose monitoring devices like Dexcom have transformed his daily management. He created the humorous online persona 'Blood Sugar Lance' on Instagram to educate others about diabetes, which began accidentally as a way to bring humor to social media. He notes that foods like white rice and white bread severely spike his blood sugar, even with insulin, and recalls challenges from earlier years when he often left glucose testing supplies at home. His personal experience, including his uncle's diabetes, and the emotional support from the diabetic community, have helped him manage his condition effectively. Despite fan speculation about a potential N’Sync reunion, Lance Bass confirms there is no current plan and cautions against believing unverified reports.
title: Lance Bass has more to say about living with diabetes than he does about an N’Sync reunion
